In this role, you’ll design scalable processes, architect integrations, and ensure Salesforce is a reliable, strategic platform that empowers our Sales, Marketing, Legal, and Finance teams. This is a high-impact role where you’ll be both a hands-on builder and a technical advisor, helping EliseAI scale its go-to-market operations.

Key Responsibilities

 - Own the configuration, customization, and ongoing management of Salesforce; including building and maintaining automations, workflows, validation rules, and custom objects.

 - Define Salesforce best practices and data governance standards.

 - Manage and optimize integrations between Salesforce and key tools (HubSpot, Outreach, ZoomInfo, IronClad, Clay, etc.)

 - Partner with stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions, owning the full lifecycle from design and build through rollout and support

 - Lead Salesforce training for new and existing employees, empowering teams to fully leverage the platform to drive business results

 - Ensure data integrity across systems through robust architecture and automated processes

 - Collaborate with GTM leaders and Revenue Operations to identify gaps and propose innovative solutions

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff.

We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

 - Proven Salesforce Admin / Architect experience at a fast-growing SaaS company (Salesforce certifications a strong plus)

 - Track record of owning Salesforce environments end-to-end: configuration, customization, and optimization

 - Experience managing and iterating on CPQ (Salesforce RCA a plus)

 - Strong understanding of Sales processes, GTM operations, and SaaS revenue workflows

 - Hands-on experience with integrations and data management across multiple systems

 - Familiarity with Salesforce architecture principles and ability to design scalable, future-proof solutions

 - SQL or equivalent data querying skills a plus

 - Comfortable working in a fast-paced, unstructured environment and independently driving initiatives

 - Willingness to work in person at our office 4–5 days per week.

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn https://www.eliseai.com/blog/eliseai-raises-250m-series-e!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

 - Equity in the company in the form of stock options

 - Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

 - Fully paid parental leave

 - Commuter benefits

 - 401k benefits

 - Monthly fitness stipend

 - A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch

 - Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

 - Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

 - We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $120,000 - $150,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

jobs.title: VP of Revenue Operations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About The Role

As the VP of Revenue Operations, you will be responsible for building and scaling the infrastructure that powers our go-to-market engine. You’ll own the design and execution of systems, tools, and processes that increase sales efficiency, improve forecasting accuracy, and drive revenue growth across the entire customer lifecycle. 

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive revenue operations strategy across the entire customer life cycle; acquisition, on-boarding, expansion, renewal, and churn

  • Lead the transformation of our GTM organization with SOTA AI tools and processes (Clay, Synthesia, etc.)

  • Design and build the organizational structure of the RevOps function, hiring and developing a high-performing team across systems, analytics, and deal operations

  • Own and evolve our revenue tech stack (e.g. Salesforce, CPQ, integrations) with a focus on automation, scalability, and usability

  • Build and scale a best-in-class deal desk function in partnership with Sales, Legal, and Finance to streamline quoting, contracting, and approvals

  • Partner with CRO and CFO on sales forecasting, goal-setting, and performance management—ensuring high accuracy and accountability across teams

  • Use data to drive strategic decisions and establish clear KPIs for pipeline health, conversion, and rep productivity

  • Ensure data hygiene, process integrity, and compliance across GTM systems

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Product, and Customer Success to align revenue strategies and optimize acquisition, expansion, and retention efforts

  • Attract top-tier talent to join our driven team

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • 10+ years of experience in revenue/sales operations, with 5+ years in a leadership role 

  • Experience in scaling a hyper-growth startup B2B tech company

  • Track record of designing and scaling RevOps teams and infrastructure

  • Deep expertise in Salesforce and related GTM tools, with a strong understanding of automation, data management, and AI integration

  • Strong analytical mindset with a bias for action; fluent in forecasting, sales analytics, and KPI management

  • Willingness to work in person at our office 4 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch.

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $275,000 - $315,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

jobs.title: GTM Sourcer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About The Role

EliseAI is growing rapidly—and world-class GTM talent is at the core of our success. We’re looking for a GTM Sourcer to help scale our pre and post sales team by identifying and engaging top-tier talent who want to build from scratch, solve hard problems, and make an impact. You’ll partner closely with recruiters, hiring managers, and company leadership to build and execute sourcing strategies that bring exceptional talent to EliseAI.

Key Responsibilities

  • Own top-of-funnel efforts to identify and engage world-class GTM talent through advanced sourcing techniques, including boolean searches, LinkedIn recruiter, Sales Navigator, in-person events, and other creative channels

  • Build and maintain strong, diverse pipelines of candidates across GTM (AEs, CSMs, etc.) and revenue operations roles

  • Partner with GTM and recruiting leadership to deeply understand hiring needs and requirements for open roles

  • Iterate quickly on outreach and targeting strategies based on feedback, hiring trends, and performance data

  • Represent EliseAI’s brand and value proposition effectively to passive candidates who may not yet know us

  • Contribute to the ongoing improvement of sourcing processes and tools, helping us move faster and smarter

  • Track sourcing metrics and candidate quality to inform data-driven decisions and priorities

  • Attract top-tier talent to join our driven team

Requirements

  • 2–5 years of experience in a GTM sourcing role, preferably at a high-growth startup or fast-paced tech company

  • Proven ability to identify and engage highly sought-after GTM talent, especially those who may not be actively job-seeking

  • Deep understanding of sales and customer success roles, org structures, to effectively screen and communicate with candidates

  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple open reqs and priorities simultaneously

  • High EQ and strong communication skills—you know how to craft thoughtful, compelling outreach and build genuine relationships

  • Self-motivated, curious, and always looking for new ways to find great talent

  • Willingness to work in person at our office 5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch.

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $80,000 - $140,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

jobs.title: Strategy and Planning, Senior Manager | Housing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About The Role

As a Strategy & Planning - Senior Manager, you will be spearheading the launch of new strategic initiatives, driving market expansion efforts, and supporting the overall development and execution of the company’s strategy and business operations. The ideal candidate should be a strategic thinker, with strong business acumen, and exemplify strong operational excellence. The candidate should have a proven track record in managing complex projects and initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Initiatives Development:

  • Collaborate with the SVP of Strategy to identify, develop, and implement new strategic initiatives aligned with company objectives

  • Conduct comprehensive market research and competitive analysis to inform strategic decision-making

  • Develop detailed project plans, including timelines, and resource allocation

AI Transformation Strategy:

  • Partner with senior executives at client organizations to co-develop their AI roadmaps by deeply understanding their business operations and goals

  • Provide data-driven recommendations to improve client operational and strategic outcomes

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • 7-8 years of experience in management consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy, product management, or founders/operational roles at high growth startups

  • Exceptionally strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make  data-driven strategic recommendations and decisions

  • Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels

  • Ability to take ownership, be autonomous, and thrive in working in a fast-paced environment

  • Strong practical, problem-solver with the ability to execute

  • Relentlessness, with a hands-on, get-it-done approach

  • Willingness to work in person at our office 4-5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch.

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $200,000 - $250,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

 - Provide data-driven recommendations to improve client operational and strategic outcomes

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

 - 7-8 years of experience in management consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy, product management, or founders/operational roles at high growth startups

 - Exceptionally strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make  data-driven strategic recommendations and decisions

 - Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels

 - Ability to take ownership, be autonomous, and thrive in working in a fast-paced environment

 - Strong practical, problem-solver with the ability to execute

 - Relentlessness, with a hands-on, get-it-done approach

 - Willingness to work in person at our office 4-5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn! https://www.eliseai.com/blog/eliseai-raises-250m-series-e) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

 - Equity in the company in the form of stock options

 - Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

 - Fully paid parental leave

 - Commuter benefits

 - 401k benefits

 - Monthly fitness stipend

 - A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch.

 - Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

 - Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

 - We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $200,000 - $250,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. jobs.title: Product Operations Manager | Housing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About The Role

In this role, you will drive scaling of our housing products, and will lead both strategic decision-making and operational execution. You will also focus on enhancing our growth trajectory and operational efficiency with our team, ensuring agility and effectiveness.

Key Responsibilities

  • Program manage new product launches; hosting internal product knowledge sessions and implementation training, own the creation of enablement materials and more

  • Lead upcoming product compliance projects, focusing on finance and insurance offerings. Collaborate closely with legal, product, and business teams to ensure product launch readiness

  • Own feedback loop conversations synthesizing data across multiple channels such as Gong snippets, Support Tickets, Surveys and more, acting as Voice of the Customer helping us find solutions to achieve short and long-term goals

  • Work closely with Product and Engineering to enhance product offerings, ensuring they deliver maximum value to clients and address market needs effectively. Experience in product management is a plus

  • Conduct thorough discovery sessions with new clients to understand their product area and requirements

  • Attract top-tier talent to join our driven team

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.
We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • Experience working at an early-stage startup in an operational/generalist role

  • A proven track record of working in heavily regulated industries

  • Willingness to take on a variety of roles

  • Ability to prioritize effectively and get things done in an unstructured and ambiguous environment

  • Ability to take ownership and accountability

  • Willingness to work in person at our NYC office 4-5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $140,000 - $180,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

jobs.title: Customer Success Specialist | Housing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About The Role

As a Customer Success Specialist, you will support our customer success team. This is a customer-facing, strategic role that works closely with Customer Success Managers to help customers achieve long-term success with our platform.

You will contribute to onboarding, engagement, and retention by leveraging data, developing product expertise, and collaborating cross-functionally to enhance the customer experience. This role is ideal for someone with strong operational or customer-facing experience who is ready to deepen their expertise in Customer Success. You will play a critical role in onboarding, customer outreach, and helping customers derive meaningful value from the platform.

Key Responsibilities

  • Partner with Customer Success Managers to onboard customers, aligning on key goals and ensuring successful implementation

  • Develop deep knowledge of the EliseAI platform to guide customers effectively and provide insight-driven recommendations

  • Proactively engage with customers to drive product adoption, satisfaction, and long-term retention

  • Monitor usage data, feedback, and health metrics using tools like PlanHat, Zendesk, and Slack to identify risks and opportunities; share insights and recommend action plans

  • Host and support onboarding webinars, customer training sessions, and other scaled engagement initiatives

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Support, and Sales teams to troubleshoot issues and advocate for customer needs

  • Recommend and help implement process improvements to increase team efficiency and elevate the customer experience

  • Contribute to Customer Success strategy by identifying patterns, risks, gaps, and scalable practices that benefit the broader customer base and help customers realize success and ROI

  • Attract top-tier talent to join our driven team

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • 1–3 years of professional experience in customer-facing, project coordination, or support roles

  • Strong communication skills and a clear, organized working style

  • Comfortable navigating ambiguity and collaborating across multiple teams

  • Interest in growing into a full Customer Success Manager role over time

  • Experience in SaaS, real estate, or healthcare industries is a plus

  • Eagerness to develop deep product expertise to better support customer outcomes

  • Familiarity with tools like PlanHat, Zendesk, Slack, or similar platforms is a plus

  • Willingness to work in person at our office 4-5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch.

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $70,000 - $90,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

jobs.title: GTM Strategy and Operations Associate | Housing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About The Role

We’re hiring a GTM Strategy & Operations Associate to drive the projects and strategic insights that unlock growth. This isn’t just internal ops; we’re looking for someone who wants to get close to the customer, understand what drives value, and work directly with sales, product, and leadership to scale what works. You’ll shape how we position, sell, and deliver our product to the market.

This role is ideal for someone with a consulting or high-performance strategy background who’s ready to own outcomes, not just advise on them. You’ll have the chance to move fast, work across functions, and influence everything from sales plays to customer expansion and enterprise pricing.

Key Requirements

  • Identify where and how we win by analyzing customer conversations, win/loss trends, competitive insights, and sales performance

  • Own and execute projects that directly improve sales velocity, conversion rates, and expansion outcomes

  • Work directly with AEs, CSMs, and clients to refine how we communicate value, deliver ROI, and differentiate from competitors

  • Design and implement scalable playbooks for pricing, sales strategy, onboarding, and post-sale success

  • Serve as a thought partner to Sales and Product leadership, bringing insights that drive product roadmap and GTM prioritization

  • Run competitive deep-dives and enable the team with actionable intel and training

  • Build internal operating rhythms - reporting, forecasting, process optimization - to help the GTM org run smarter

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • 2–5 years of experience in top-tier consulting, investment banking, or a high-growth startup in a strategic role

  • Proven ability to structure ambiguous problems, drive execution, and influence cross-functionally

  • Strong slide-builder and effective in Excel/Sheets; SQL and scripting experience are valuable

  • Excellent communicator; clear, direct, and confident in front of both executives and customers

  • Comfortable in fast-moving, high-accountability environments

  • Ambition to grow into a leadership role, or start a company someday; you see this as the best crash course in building a sales org

  • Willingness to work in person at our office 4-5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $110,000 - $160,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

jobs.title: IT Support Specialist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About The Role

We’re looking for an IT Support Specialist to own IT operations in our NYC office and support our growing network in San Francisco, Boston, and beyond.

As the go-to IT partner onsite, you’ll ensure employees have the tools and support they need to do their best work, whether it’s setting up devices, resolving technical issues, or maintaining local infrastructure. You’ll collaborate closely with People Operations and Security teams, driving improvements that make IT systems simpler, faster, and more reliable. This role is ideal for someone who’s resourceful, self-motivated, and eager to solve problems hands-on.

Key Responsibilities

  • Device Management: Procure, configure, and set up laptops, monitors, and peripherals for new hires and employees

  • Provisioning & Security: Enroll devices in required security tools, ensure compliance with provisioning processes, and manage device configuration through MDM solutions

  • Support & Troubleshooting: Provide Tier 1 IT support, resolving issues across macOS, Windows, SaaS platforms, networking, and AV systems (including password resets, software installs, and hardware troubleshooting)

  • Lifecycle Management: Coordinate laptop upgrades, trade-ins, and refresh cycles; provide temporary replacement devices and maximize equipment lifespan

  • Software Support: Maintain and support core systems such as Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, Zoom, Adobe Suite, and other business-critical SaaS tools

  • Onboarding: Lead IT onboarding for new hires, ensuring a seamless day-one experience and smooth ramp-up

  • IT Infrastructure: Maintain and improve local office systems (WiFi, conferencing gear, printers, dashboards) and coordinate with vendors or building management as needed

  • Automation & Documentation: Implement light automations to streamline recurring tasks, manage software updates/provisioning, and create clear technical guides for employees

  • Collaboration & Events: Support company meetings and events by setting up AV equipment, Zoom links, and providing live technical support

  • Inventory Management: Own local hardware inventory, office setups, and full device lifecycle management

  • Attract top-tier talent to join our driven team

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • 1–3 years of IT or technical support experience with hands-on troubleshooting across macOS and Windows

  • Deep familiarity with SaaS tools such as Google Workspace, Slack, Okta, and MDM solutions (Hexnode, Jamf preferred)

  • Understanding of identity and access management (SSO) concepts

  • Resourceful and comfortable navigating ambiguity and taking initiative to go the extra mile and solve problems independently

  • Organized and detail-oriented, with strong follow-through and proactive communication.

  • Excited to grow beyond traditional helpdesk tasks, developing skills in infrastructure, automation, and systems administration

  • Collaborative and communicative: able to partner effectively across teams and translate technical issues into clear, actionable information

  • Willingness to work in person at our office 5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $75-90K. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

About the Role

EliseAI invites top-tier professionals in Machine Learning and adjacent disciplines to join our team. This position is perfectly suited for individuals with a robust mathematical and quantitative foundation—this includes, but is not limited to, mathematicians, theoretical physicists, and computer scientists—who are eager to apply their knowledge to tangible challenges. As a junior research scientist at EliseAI, you will join a fast-moving team of world-class researchers engaged in groundbreaking research on machine learning and large language models, developing predictive models to advance our AI capabilities, and much more. If you thrive in a vibrant startup setting and are keen to apply your academic expertise to innovative applications, we encourage you to connect with us.

Note: For this position, we will conduct a 1-month trial period before transitioning to full-time employment. 

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and refine machine learning architectures optimized for advanced conversational flow

  • Conduct comprehensive analyses to support decision-making and improve the effectiveness of our AI solutions

  • Apply advanced mathematical and machine learning techniques to solve specific problems such as optimizing tenant engagement strategies, predicting tenant behavior, and improving customer interaction processes

  • Stay abreast of the latest research in machine learning and AI, and apply innovative approaches to improve our products

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product development, and data science, to integrate and deploy machine learning models

  • Work with the latest Large Language Models to leverage the power of generative AI on production scale data

If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • Ph.D. in Mathematics, Theoretical Physics, Computer Science, or a related field

  • Strong foundation in machine learning algorithms, statistical analysis, and data modeling

  • Demonstrated ability to apply analytical thinking and problem-solving skills to real-world challenges

  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar, with experience in machine learning libraries and frameworks

  • Willingness to work in person at our office 4-5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch.

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation

Exact compensation inclusive of salary and any bonuses is determined based on a number of factors including experience and skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

 - Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.
   

 - Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round https://www.eliseai.com/blog/eliseai-raises-250m-series-e led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About the Role

EliseAI invites top-tier professionals in Machine Learning and adjacent disciplines to join our team. This position is perfectly suited for individuals with a robust mathematical and quantitative foundation—this includes, but is not limited to, mathematicians, theoretical physicists, and computer scientists—who are eager to apply their knowledge to tangible challenges. As a junior research scientist at EliseAI, you will join a fast-moving team of world-class researchers engaged in groundbreaking research on machine learning and large language models, developing predictive models to advance our AI capabilities, and much more. If you thrive in a vibrant startup setting and are keen to apply your academic expertise to innovative applications, we encourage you to connect with us.

Note: For this position, we will conduct a 1-month trial period before transitioning to full-time employment. 

Key Responsibilities

 - Develop and refine machine learning architectures optimized for advanced conversational flow

 - Conduct comprehensive analyses to support decision-making and improve the effectiveness of our AI solutions

 - Apply advanced mathematical and machine learning techniques to solve specific problems such as optimizing tenant engagement strategies, predicting tenant behavior, and improving customer interaction processes

 - Stay abreast of the latest research in machine learning and AI, and apply innovative approaches to improve our products

 - Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product development, and data science, to integrate and deploy machine learning models

 - Work with the latest Large Language Models to leverage the power of generative AI on production scale data

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

 - Ph.D. in Mathematics, Theoretical Physics, Computer Science, or a related field

 - Strong foundation in machine learning algorithms, statistical analysis, and data modeling

 - Demonstrated ability to apply analytical thinking and problem-solving skills to real-world challenges

 - Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar, with experience in machine learning libraries and frameworks

 - Willingness to work in person at our office 4-5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn! https://www.eliseai.com/blog/eliseai-raises-250m-series-e) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

 - Equity in the company in the form of stock options

 - Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

 - Fully paid parental leave

 - Commuter benefits

 - 401k benefits

 - Monthly fitness stipend

 - A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch.

 - Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

 - Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

 - We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation

The salary range for this role is $150,000 - $230,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation inclusive of salary and any bonuses is determined based on a number of factors including experience and skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

 

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

jobs.title: Marketing Operations Manager | Housing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About The Role

As Marketing Operations Manager, you’ll be the architect and operator of the systems, processes, and insights that keep our marketing engine running at full throttle. You’ll take ownership of our MarTech stack, ensure data is pristine, and deliver the reporting and analytics that empower our team to move fast and scale smart.

You won’t just keep the trains running—you’ll help design the track. This is a high-visibility, high-impact role where you’ll partner with Demand Generation, Product Marketing, Sales, and RevOps to fuel pipeline growth, increase conversion rates, and make sure every marketing dollar works harder.

Key Responsibilities

  • Administer, optimize, and expand our marketing automation platform (HubSpot) and its Salesforce integration to deliver seamless execution

  • Build and refine scoring, routing, and enrichment processes that ensure sales gets the right leads at the right time.

  • Create and maintain real-time dashboards and campaign performance reports that make it easy to see what’s working (and what’s not)

  • Implement and manage attribution models that give full visibility into marketing’s impact on pipeline and revenue

  • Document and standardize workflows so campaigns launch faster, cleaner, and with less friction

  • Support ABM and demand generation programs with advanced segmentation, targeting, and personalization

  • Work closely with Sales, RevOps, and Product Marketing to ensure alignment on KPIs, messaging, and measurement

  • Attract top-tier talent to join our driven team

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.
We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of marketing operations, revenue operations, or similar experience in a fast-paced B2B SaaS environment

  • Hands-on expertise with HubSpot (or similar marketing automation) and Salesforce CRM

  • Strong grasp of demand generation, ABM, and full-funnel digital marketing best practices

  • Proven experience managing lead scoring, attribution, and campaign tracking at scale

  • Proficiency in analytics and visualization tools (starting with manual analysis in Excel, and moving beyond that in time)

  • Obsessed with process improvement, data accuracy, and efficiency

  • Excellent communicator who thrives in cross-functional settings

  • Willingness to work in person at our office 4-5 days a week

Why Join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $130,000 - $170,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation is determined based on a number of factors including experience, skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

jobs.title: Product Counsel
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About the role

You will report to the Head of Legal, and will play a key role in supporting product compliance and other regulatory matters for the company (along with a sprinkling of other matters that may arise, as needed). We are looking for someone eager to learn about the legal functions and operations of a rapidly-growing SaaS company and the legal challenges unique to the AI space. This will be the first dedicated product counsel hire for the company, but this hire will be supported by the rest of the legal team.

In this role, you will be responsible for tracking and triaging a large number of projects at any given time. We are seeking a candidate who is equally comfortable prioritizing velocity or meticulous attention to detail, as circumstances merit, and who possesses a strong instinct for how to effectively balance these competing priorities.

The ideal candidate can excel in diverse working environments—whether that means following detailed guidance or taking initiative on large, open-ended projects. This hire will work across both our real estate and healthcare business lines, so we’re looking for someone who can learn quickly and views new challenges with excitement rather than intimidation.

Key Responsibilities

  • Owning large, complex regulatory/compliance projects and driving them to completion

  • Becoming a subject matter expert and trusted advisor on relevant regulatory regimes

  • Working with product and engineering teams to drive product compliance

  • Proactively tracking new and amended laws and guidance to ensure we remain compliant in an rapidly-changing legal landscape

  • Speaking with customers to address their questions and concerns

  • Developing and delivering training programs to company stakeholders to ensure compliance with policies and best practices

  • Assisting with other miscellaneous legal matters that may arise and taking on ad hoc projects in other areas across the business

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

Qualifications:

  • Juris Doctor (JD) degree (or foreign equivalent) from a top law school

  • Admitted to practice law in New York State with good standing, or willing and able to waive in to New York

  • 3-5 years of legal experience:

    • 2+ years of experience working in a top law firm’s regulatory/compliance practice (or other practice area of meaningful relevance)

    • 1+ years of experience working as a product counsel in a high-growth SaaS company preferred but not required

Skills:

  • Strong legal researcher–demonstrated ability to reliably and thoroughly source data/information, interpret such information and augment with necessary context, and provide actionable recommendations or guidance to decision makers

  • Experience parsing and distilling complex statutes and regulations

  • Experience researching case law and extracting/abstracting principles therein to better interpret statutes

  • Ability to effectively and clearly communicate with customers and other outside parties

  • Highly organized; rigorous attention to detail

  • Experience working with regulatory regimes relating to AI, housing, healthcare, and/or data privacy a plus but not required

Mindset:

  • Comfortable both owning deadlines with minimal supervision and taking instruction/working in close partnership with others

  • Enthusiastic, can-do approach; excited to work hard at a fast-growing startup

  • Has a startup mindset, strong sense of ownership, and a proper balance of quality and sense of urgency

  • Team player with collaborative instincts

  • Willingness to work in person at our NYC office 4-5 days a week

Why join

Growth and impact. It’s not often that you can get in on the ground floor of a funded (unicorn!) startup that’s scaling so fast. That means that instead of following a playbook, you’ll be writing it. Every single day you will be challenged to identify how we can scale and execute on it. You’ll learn what works when you succeed and what doesn’t when you fail. Either way, the rest of the team will be here to support you.

Benefits

In addition to the growth and impact you’ll have at EliseAI, we offer competitive salaries along with the following benefits:

  • Equity in the company in the form of stock options

  • Medical, Dental and Vision premiums covered at 100%

  • Fully paid parental leave

  • Commuter benefits

  • 401k benefits

  • Monthly fitness stipend

  • A collaborative in-office environment with an open floor plan, fully stocked kitchen, and company-paid lunch.

  • Fun company social events through our Elise and the City program

  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays

  • We'll cover relocation packages and make the move exciting, not painful!

Job Compensation Range

The salary range for this role is $170,000 - $200,000. EliseAI offers a competitive total rewards package which includes base salary, equity, and a comprehensive benefits & perks package. Exact compensation inclusive of salary and any bonuses is determined based on a number of factors including experience and skill level, location and qualifications which are assessed during the interview process. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided by our Recruiting Team during the hiring process.

EliseAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Please note that employment with EliseAI is on an "at-will" basis, which means that either the employee or the company may terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause or notice.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@eliseai.com

jobs.title: Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About EliseAI

At EliseAI, we're improving the industries that matter most: housing and healthcare. Everyone needs a place to live and access to quality healthcare, yet both are often harder to secure than they should be.

By integrating AI agents deeply into existing workflows, we make them more efficient, reduce costs, and improve the experience for everyone.

  • Healthcare: We make it easy to schedule appointments, complete intake forms, and we help patients communicate with providers, so everyone can focus on health instead of paperwork.

  • Housing: We simplify how renters tour apartments, sign leases, submit maintenance requests, and stay connected with their property team—bringing everything they need for their home into one place.

With EliseAI, organizations reduce manual work, improve accessibility, and deliver a seamless experience across essential services. We recently raised a $250 million Series E round led by Andreessen Horowitz to accelerate this mission.

About the role

EliseAI is growing rapidly - to support that growth, we are looking to add an ambitious Recruiter to our recruiting team. You will work closely with other Recruiters, Recruiting Coordinators and EliseAI leadership to bring exceptional talent to EliseAI, owning the entire recruiting life cycle. The ideal candidate will have passion and experience around innovative sourcing and outreach strategies, technology and recruiting best practices, and has a track record of success bringing top talent to SaaS companies.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support all aspects of the recruiting process across technical and non-technical roles, while working closely with hiring managers and EliseAI leadership

  • Collaborate and establish relationships with leaders across the company to understand their hiring objectives and ideal candidate profile

  • Build a strong pipeline of candidates by utilizing a range of sourcing techniques, including LinkedIn and other outside-the-box sourcing strategies, while staying on top of hiring market trends

  • Identify, prescreen, and evaluate both passive and active candidates to ensure high quality talent 

  • Hold intake meetings with interviewers to ensure a thorough and comprehensive hiring process and high-quality candidate experience

  • Maintain our ATS to ensure effective reporting and a data driven recruiting approach

  • Run debriefs on the hiring process and continuously implement improvements 

  • Own creation of job descriptions and practical assessments 

  • Manage relationships with our external recruiting agencies 

  • Plan campus and lateral recruiting events, career fairs, meetups, etc.

  • Ensure all candidates in the recruitment process have a positive experience with EliseAI

  • Support other ad-hoc recruiting projects

  • Attract top-tier talent to join our driven team

Move at rocket speed, build something massive.

We’re scaling fast, solving real client problems with precision and ambition. Here, you own your impact; full autonomy, no micromanagement, no fluff. We hire the best, expect the best, and give you the masterclass of your career. It’s hard, it’s intense, and it’s the most rewarding work you’ll ever do. If you’re hungry, driven, and ready to build something massive, climb aboard.

Requirements

  • 1-5 years of experience as a full-cycle Recruiter

  • Experience working at a high growth startup or fast paced environment
